lines.text: [Gilhooley about to throw bottle during fight]
Not the brandy, you dope!

[puts bottle carefully down on bar]
Sorry!
Permission to speak.
Shoot.
What started it was this knothead tried to push a hootchie-cootchie dancer off on me in Panama!
[Gilhooley laughs]
Gilhooley? Well, What's wrong with that?
Nothing, except a marriage licence and wedding ring through my nose went with it!
You know, Michael Donovan, you're quite a - a fella.
Well, you know, Amelia Dedham...
[Pulls her close while fishing a cigarette out of his pocket]
You're quite a gal. Cigarette?

[She turns away from him]
What's a matter?
I had the strangest feeling that you were going to kiss me.
What?
Well, I have been kissed before.
[Walks inside to turn out the light then walks back out, spins her around and kisses her]

[Flustered]
Ah! I... I...
[Dazed]
I thought I'd been kissed before.
[Kisses him back]
Well, there is our Mike Donovan. Three children and not one marriage. Oh, I do not say that he's the first man to put the cart before the horse, but three carts and no horse? Huh?
I beg your pardon sir. Did I understand you to say, "Limeys?"
I heard him.
Me too.

[Enters]
Gilhooley! Where the Hell is my suit?

[Slaps Donovan on the chest]
Stay out of this little man. You might get hurt.
You guys uh, looking for trouble?
Tipperary born and bred Limeys.
Oh Monk, you're not gonna let three guys gang up on one guy even if it is Gilhooley.

[Shakes his head]
I seen it done.
Three against two.
[Pokes Donovan in the chest]
Me?
[laughs]
Its the holidays. Christmas. Have a drink.
I will, then.
On the house. Look, we're noble allies. Coral Seas - we were with you.
He's got a point
Yeah, a definite point.
Ah, my apologies to you sir.
And a Happy New Year to us all.
FESTUS!
[Enter Festus, smiling and eager]
My little brother. Festus, we're having a sporting event. Turn your hat around. You are now a Yank. Three against -
[punched by Festus]
Ameilia, if I consent to marry you...
If you consent!
...and if we are blessed with a child, and if it is a boy, he will be named Francis Xavier Donovan after my father.
He will be named Sedley Atterbury Dedham after my grandfather.
Sedley Atterbury... that's a hell of a name for a Donovan!
He will be named William after my father.
The doc? That's swell. I'll call him Bill. Pax?
Aw, Monk, you're not gonna let three guys take on one - even if it is Gilhooley.
I seen it done.
Step aside, little man.

[reading inscription on monument]
Princess Manulani, Commander William... Dedham? Michael Patrick Donovan... Thomas Al-oy-si-us Gilhooley...
Thomas Aloysius Gilhooley!
Does this mean there was actual fighting on this island?
Well, those gold stars don't stand for good behavior.
Well, tell me.

There's not much to tell. We got blown off our can... that's a destroyer, ended up here on the island. There was a big Jap base down there. So, we hid out back here in the hills... down in those caves. Tossed a few monkey wrenches into their machinery, threw 'em a few spitballs.
Hard to believe that war has ever been within a thousand miles of a place as peaceful as this.
Yeah, well, frangipani and flame-throwers don't seem to go together, but that's the way it was.
Gilhooley?
Gilhooley.
Oh, Uncle Guns, please don't fight, don't spoil our party.
You stay out of it!
Go on Uncle Guns. Knock his block off!
I'll knock both his blocks off.

[while being pushed off by Gilhooley]
Oh, you've come back to marry me.
Oh, now look LaFleur, you're the love of my life. You're the only dame that meant anything to me, but I already told you I'd make a -
[takes a big gulp of beer]
I know.
I got a wife in Hoboken.
...and San Pedro, and San Diego and Norfolk, Virginia.
That's right. You wouldn't want me to go up on a bigamy charge, would you?
If I may venture a suggestion. A scenic drive? A chilled apertif? I have a picnic basket. I'd be delighted...
Well, that's very kind of you, your... Excellency. But I have promised to take Luki home this morning.
Knock it off Uncle Andy! Quit trying to horn in on my date.

[Sending Morse Code message to Doc]
Let's have it.

[Reads note from Gilhooley]
"Doc, Mayday, your Boston dotter here." Dotter, D-O-T-T-E-R.
That's right. Two T's.
Insert name of? Her name's Amelia!
How do I know? I ain't shackin' up with her!
Captain, I should like to charter the Araner for however long it takes me to find my father and take me back to Honolulu.
Um... well, as to that...
The Araner is not for charter; she has too much draft for the Low Islands. Reefs and coral heads.
Thank you Mr. Donovan. I was speaking to the sailing master. Captain, it should only take...
But I OWN the Araner, and the Inisfar and the Inisfree, and several others. You might say that we are rivals, competitors in the shipping business.

[oft repeated line]
Pax?
Say, I have a wonderful idea! How would you like to spend Christmas at my house?
[as everyone stares at her, she suddenly realizes she had just committed a faux pas]
You mean that would be better than putting up a Christmas tree in a saloon?
...No. I... Well, naturally you would want to spend Christmas with your father.
Thank you, Amelia. I think it would be nice to spend Christmas in your father's house.
Well, that settles that... Father!
[Cluseot]
Not that way. That's a saloon. The gate.
My, what a beautiful gown. Are you contemplating matrimony?

[Sarcastically]
What young girl my age ISN'T 'contemplating matrimony'?
How true.
